div.id: Updates on Fulton County Facility closures and Service Change
div.aria-label: fulton-warning Updates on Fulton County Facility closures and Service Change
div.h5: Updates on Fulton County Facility closures and Service Change

p.a: Read the Latest on Fulton County Closures and Service Changes

div.p: Click HERE to complete your 2020 Census today. #FultonCounts

div.h3: Updates on Fulton County Facility closures and Service Changes
div.div: Fulton County is in communication with the Fulton County Board of Health, the Georgia Department of Public Health, the CDC, the Governor’s office, our school systems and 15 cities in responding to COVID-19 and its impact on our communities.

a.title: Read more about Updates on Fulton County Facility closures and Service Changes
a.aria-label: Read more about Updates on Fulton County Facility closures and Service Changes

div.h3: Vice Chair Arrington to Host Virtual Town Hall
div.div: Fulton County Vice-Chairman Marvin S. Arrington, Jr. is scheduled to host a virtual Town Hall meeting with District 5 constituents to discuss community services impacted by the COVID-19 crisis and efforts to assist the community at this difficult time.

a.title: Read more about Vice Chair Arrington to Host Virtual Town Hall
a.aria-label: Read more about Vice Chair Arrington to Host Virtual Town Hall

div.h3: Six New Symptoms of Covid-19 Added to List
div.div: Six new symptoms have been added to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s (CDC) existing list of symptoms for COVID-19. The new symptoms are chills, repeated shaking with chills, muscle pain, headache, sore throat, and new loss of taste and/or smell.

a.title: Read more about Six New Symptoms of Covid-19 Added to List
a.aria-label: Read more about Six New Symptoms of Covid-19 Added to List

div.div: Fulton County is expanding the availability of COVID-19 testing with the addition of new testing sites and collaboration with public and private partners. Altogether, 50,000 residents can be tested in the coming month.

a.title: Read more about Fulton County Expanding COVID-19 Testing
a.aria-label: Read more about Fulton County Expanding COVID-19 Testing

div.h3: Pen Pals Program to Keep Seniors Connected
div.div: Program targets isolated and homebound seniors

a.title: Read more about Pen Pals Program to Keep Seniors Connected
a.aria-label: Read more about Pen Pals Program to Keep Seniors Connected

div.div: Fulton Today highlights the new information the County Manager shares for residents and employees, the District Attorney explains how they have modified justice operations, the $10M relief grant benefactors, and virtual classes for seniors and artists.

a.title: Read more about Fulton Today COVID-19 Update April 20
a.aria-label: Read more about Fulton Today COVID-19 Update April 20

div.h3: Fulton County Awards Grants for Organizations Public Entities and Artists
div.div: The Fulton County Board of Commissioners approved $1.62 million in funding through the Fulton County Department of Arts & Culture Contracts for Services Program (CFS). was approved to provide support for 137 nonprofit organizations and individual artists.

a.title: Read more about Fulton County Awards Grants for Organizations Public Entities and Artists
a.aria-label: Read more about Fulton County Awards Grants for Organizations Public Entities and Artists

div.h3: Senior Services Kicks off Online Classes to Keep Seniors Connected and Active
div.div: The Department of Senior Services wants seniors to maintain their health and wellness. The Department has initiated online classes to allow seniors to remain active and connected to their classes as Fulton County continues to adhere to social distancing guidelines to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

a.title: Read more about Senior Services Kicks off Online Classes to Keep Seniors Connected and Active
a.aria-label: Read more about Senior Services Kicks off Online Classes to Keep Seniors Connected and Active

div.h3: Fulton Board of Registration and Elections Meeting
div.div: The Fulton County Board of Registrations & Elections met to discuss adjustments to poll locations in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic.

a.title: Read more about Fulton Board of Registration and Elections Meeting
a.aria-label: Read more about Fulton Board of Registration and Elections Meeting

div.div: The Fulton County Board of Commissioners will hold their regular monthly meeting in Assembly Hall inside the Fulton County Government Center (Pryor Street level).

a.title: Read more about Board of Commissioners Meetings
a.aria-label: Read more about Board of Commissioners Meetings

div.h3: Fulton County Board of Assessors 2020 Meeting
div.div: Unless otherwise posted, all meetings are held at 12:30 p.m. in Suite 1400, 235 Peachtree Street, NE, Atlanta, GA 30303.

a.title: Read more about Fulton County Board of Assessors 2020 Meeting
a.aria-label: Read more about Fulton County Board of Assessors 2020 Meeting

div.p: Fulton County is governed by a seven-member Board of Commissioners who are elected to four-year terms. Six of the members are district commissioners, and the Chairman is At-Large, representing all of Fulton County. The Board of Commissioners meet on the first and third Wednesday of each month at 10 a.m. Meetings are live streamed on FGTV.

a.title: Read more about Robb Pitts
a.aria-label: Read more about Robb Pitts

div.span: Robb Pitts is the Chairman of Fulton County Board of Commissioners. He previously served on the Fulton County Board of Commissioners from November 2002 to December 2014. During his tenure, he advocated for diversification in revenue sources to relieve the tax burden on property owners.

a.title: Read more about Robb Pitts
a.aria-label: Read more about Robb Pitts

a.title: Read more about Liz Hausmann
a.aria-label: Read more about Liz Hausmann

div.p: Liz Hausmann, Fulton County Commissioner representing District 1 in Northeast Fulton which includes the 4 cities east of Georgia 400, Johns Creek, East Alpharetta, East Roswell and Sandy Springs.

a.title: Read more about Liz Hausmann
a.aria-label: Read more about Liz Hausmann

a.title: Read more about Bob Ellis
a.aria-label: Read more about Bob Ellis

div.p: Bob Ellis is the Commissioner for District 2 which encompasses Milton, Mountain Park and large parts of Alpharetta, Roswell and Sandy Springs.

a.title: Read more about Bob Ellis
a.aria-label: Read more about Bob Ellis

a.title: Read more about Lee Morris
a.aria-label: Read more about Lee Morris

p.span: Lee Morris is the Commissioner for District 3, which encompasses the southern part of Sandy Springs, all of Buckhead, and parts of Midtown.

a.title: Read more about Lee Morris
a.aria-label: Read more about Lee Morris

a.title: Read more about Natalie Hall
a.aria-label: Read more about Natalie Hall

div.div: Natalie Hall is Fulton County Commissioner of District 4, which encompasses the heart of Atlanta, downtown, Midtown, Old 4th Ward, and neighborhoods west of downtown Atlanta to Fulton Industrial Boulevard.

a.title: Read more about Natalie Hall
a.aria-label: Read more about Natalie Hall

a.title: Read more about Marvin S. Arrington JR.
a.aria-label: Read more about Marvin S. Arrington JR.

div.span: Marvin Arrington, Jr. Esq., serves Fulton County as Commissioner of District 5, which encompasses, East Atlanta, East Point, South Fulton, and small parts of Union City and College Park.

a.title: Read more about Marvin S. Arrington JR.
a.aria-label: Read more about Marvin S. Arrington JR.

a.title: Read more about Joe Carn
a.aria-label: Read more about Joe Carn

div.p: Joe Carn is the Commissioner for District 6, which includes the cities of Chattahoochee Hills, Palmetto, Fairburn and Hapeville, portions of the cities of College Park, South Fulton, Union City, East Point and Atlanta.

a.title: Read more about Joe Carn
a.aria-label: Read more about Joe Carn

div.p: Enter your address to find out which district you live in.

div.div: An error occurred or your address was not found

div.p: Fulton County is in the north-central portion of Georgia. As of 2017 estimates, the population was 1,041,423, making it the state's most populous county and its only one with over one million inhabitants.
